name: Titanium.UI.ScrollView
summary: A view that contains a horizontally and/or vertically-scrollable region of content.

events.name: scroll
events.summary: Fired when the scrollable region is scrolled.

properties.name: contentSize
properties.summary: The current content size of the scroll view defined by its width and height properties.

properties.name: decelerating
properties.summary: Indicates whether the scroll is decelerating.

properties.name: dragging
properties.summary: Indicates whether the event was fired during a dragging gesture, where the touch remained in contact with the display to physically drag the view, as opposed to it being the result of scrolling momentum.

properties.name: zooming
properties.summary: Indicates whether the event was fired during a zooming operation. This is only available from Release 3.2.3 of the Titanium Mobile SDK.

properties.name: curZoomScale
properties.summary: The current scaling factor of the scroll view content. This might not be equal to the zoomScale property or be within the range specified by minZoomScale and maxZoomScale. This is only available from Release 3.2.3 of the Titanium Mobile SDK.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: X coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Y coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: scale
events.summary: Fired when the zoom scale factor changes.

properties.name: scale
properties.summary: New scaling factor as a float.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: dragstart
events.summary: Fired when the scrollable region starts being dragged.
events.description: A dragging gesture is when a touch remains in contact with the display to physically drag the view, as opposed to it being the result of scrolling momentum.

events.name: dragStart
events.summary: Fired when the scrollable region starts being dragged.
events.description:
This event has been deprecated and renamed dragstart (lower case).

A dragging gesture is when a touch remains in contact with the display to physically drag the view, as opposed to it being the result of scrolling momentum.

events.name: dragend
events.summary: Fired when the scrollable region stops being dragged.
events.description: A dragging gesture is when a touch remains in contact with the display to physically drag the view, as opposed to it being the result of scrolling momentum.

properties.name: decelerate
properties.summary: Indicates whether scrolling will continue but decelerate, now that the drag gesture has been released by the touch. If false, scrolling will stop immediately. Is always true on Android.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: dragEnd
events.summary: Fired when the scrollable region stops being dragged.
events.description:
This event has been deprecated and renamed dragend (lower case).

A dragging gesture is when a touch remains in contact with the display to physically drag the view, as opposed to it being the result of scrolling momentum.

properties.name: decelerate
properties.summary: Indicates whether scrolling will continue but decelerate, now that the drag gesture has been released by the touch. If false, scrolling will stop immediately.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: scrollTo
methods.summary: Moves the specified coordinate of the scrollable region into the viewable area.

parameters.name: x
parameters.summary: X coordinate from the scrollable region's coordinate system.

parameters.name: y
parameters.summary: Y coordinate from the scrollable region's coordinate system.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
A simple object for specifying the animation properties when scrolling the view (since SDK 6.1.0). When set to { animated: true } it will scroll smoothly to the destination.

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: true }

methods.name: scrollToBottom
methods.summary: Moves the end of the scrollable region into the viewable area.
methods.description:
On Android the behavior of scrollToBottom depends on whether this scroll view scrolls horizontally or vertically. For vertical scroll views, scrollToBottom moves the bottom of the scrollable region into the viewable area. For horizontal scroll views, scrollToBottom moves the rightmost edge of of the scrollable region into the viewable area.

On iOS, scrollToBottom moves the bottom-right corner of the scrollable region into the viewable area.

methods.name: scrollToTop
methods.summary: Moves the top of the scrollable region into the viewable area.
methods.description:
On Android the behavior of scrollToTop depends on whether this scroll view scrolls horizontally or vertically. For vertical scroll views, scrollToTop moves the top of the scrollable region into the viewable area. For horizontal scroll views, scrollToTop moves the leftmost edge of of the scrollable region into the viewable area.

On iOS, scrollToTop moves the top-left corner of the scrollable region into the viewable area.

parameters.name: contentOffsetXY
parameters.summary: X and Y coordinates to which to reposition the top-left point of the scrollable region.

parameters.name: animated
parameters.summary:
A JS object with an animated property which determines whether the scrollable region reposition should be animated.

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: true }

parameters.name: zoomScale
parameters.summary: Scaling factor of the scroll view's content.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
A JS object with an animated property which determines whether the scrollable region reposition should be animated

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: false }

properties.name: canCancelEvents
properties.summary: Determines whether this scroll view can cancel subview touches in order to scroll instead.
properties.description:
On iOS, this property maps to the native canCancelContentTouches property which controls whether touches in the content view always lead to tracking. See UIScrollView for more details.

On Android, setting this property to false prevents the scroll view from intercepting any touch events from its subviews. Note that this behavior may be slightly different from iOS.

properties.name: contentHeight
properties.summary: Height of the scrollable region.
properties.description: While absolute dimensions are supported, relative values, such as those provided in percentages, are not. The minimum value for contentHeight is the height of the scroll view. Measured in platform-specific units; pixels on Android, effective pixels on Windows and density-independent pixels (dip) on iOS.

properties.name: contentOffset
properties.summary: X and Y coordinates to which to reposition the top-left point of the scrollable region.
properties.description: On iOS, a new value causes the scroll view to perform an animated scroll to the new offset. The setContentOffset method can be used to prevent this animation.

properties.name: contentWidth
properties.summary: Width of the scrollable region.
properties.description: While absolute dimensions are supported, relative values, such as those provided in percentages, are not. The minimum value for contentWidth is the width of the scroll view. Measured in platform-specific units; pixels on Android, effective pixels on Windows and density-independent pixels (dip) on iOS.

properties.name: decelerationRate
properties.summary: The deceleration rate of the ScrollView.

properties.name: disableBounce
properties.summary: Determines whether scroll bounce of the scrollable region is enabled.
properties.description:
Set to true to disable horizontal and vertical bounce.

This property takes precedence over the horizontalBounce and verticalBounce properties.

properties.name: horizontalBounce
properties.summary: Determines whether horizontal scroll bounce of the scrollable region is enabled.
properties.description:
With the default value of true, dragging in the horizontal direction is always allowed and also bounces.

Set to false to disable horizontal scroll bounce if the horizontal content is smaller than the scroll view bounds. However, larger content will still bounce when scrolled.

Note that the disableBounce property takes precedence over the horizontalBounce and verticalBounce properties.

properties.name: keyboardDismissMode
properties.summary: The manner in which the keyboard is dismissed when a drag begins in the scroll view.

properties.name: maxZoomScale
properties.summary: Maximum scaling factor of the scrollable region and its content.
properties.description:
This value determines how large the content can be scaled. It must be greater than the minZoomScale for zooming to be enabled. The default value is 1.0 unless otherwise specified.

Note that specifying a value less than or equal to 0 will hide all contents of the scroll view.

properties.name: minZoomScale
properties.summary: Minimum scaling factor of the scrollable region and its content.
properties.description: This value determines how small the content can be scaled. It must be less than the maxZoomScale for zooming to be enabled. The default value is 1.0 unless otherwise specified.

properties.name: overScrollMode
properties.summary: Determines the behavior when the user overscolls the view.

properties.name: refreshControl
properties.summary: View positioned above the first row that is only revealed when the user drags the scroll view contents down.
properties.description: An alternate to the pullView property. See Titanium.UI.RefreshControl for usage and examples. Since Titanium SDK 7.5.0, the RefreshControl API is also available on iOS < 10.

properties.name: scrollIndicatorStyle
properties.summary: Style of the scrollbar.

properties.name: scrollingEnabled
properties.summary: Determines whether scrolling is enabled for the view.

properties.name: scrollsToTop
properties.summary: Controls whether the scroll-to-top gesture is effective.
properties.description: The scroll-to-top gesture is a tap on the status bar; The default value of this property is true. This gesture works when you have a single visible scroll view. If there are multiple table views, web views, text areas, and/or scroll views visible, you will need to disable (set to false) on the above views that you don't want this behaviour on. The remaining view will then respond to scroll-to-top gesture.

properties.name: scrollType
properties.summary: Limits the direction of the scrollable region, overriding the deduced setting. Set to horizontal or vertical.
properties.description: See the Titanium.UI.ScrollView description for more details about how the scroll direction is deduced when this property is not defined.

properties.name: showHorizontalScrollIndicator
properties.summary: Determines whether the horizontal scroll indicator is visible.
properties.description: Set to true to show the horizontal scroll indicator.

properties.name: showVerticalScrollIndicator
properties.summary: Determines whether the vertical scroll indicator is visible.
properties.description: Set to true to show the vertical scroll indicator.

properties.name: verticalBounce
properties.summary: Determines whether vertical scroll bounce of the scrollable region is enabled.
properties.description:
With the default value of true, dragging in the vertical direction is always allowed and also bounces.

Set to false to disable vertical scroll bounce if the vertical content is smaller than the scroll view bounds. However, larger content will still bounce when scrolled.

Note that the disableBounce property takes precedence over the horizontalBounce and verticalBounce properties.

properties.name: zoomScale
properties.summary: Scaling factor of the scroll view's content.
properties.description: This value is bound by the minZoomScale and maxZoomScale properties.
